captions.text:
This underwater footage shows the moment a
dolphin tangled in a fishing net sought the
help of a diver in Hawaii.

The video from a Manta Ray diving group shows
an amazing and touching interaction between
a bottlenose dolphin and a human.

The meeting shows diver Keller Laros spend
time tending to the dolphin who graciously

Laros was leading a group of snorkelers on
a diving experience when the dolphin squealed out.

As it swam right up and pushed itself into
him, Laros soon noticed that the dolphin's

movements were inhibited because it was entangled
in fishing line and a hook was lodged in one

The dolphin calmly and patiently allowed the
human to work to help it break free.

title: Amazing video shows dolphin seeking help from human

comments.text:
Дельфин, запутавшийся в рыболовной сети, попросил помощи у водолаза.........
Во время одной из экскурсий по морскому дну группа дайверов на Гавайях 
столкнулась с удивительной ситуацией. Дельфин, проплывавший мимо одного из 
аквалангистов, случайно оказался в рыболовной сети. Животное 
незамедлительно подплыло к водолазу, словно прося его о помощи. Дайвер 
достаточно быстро освободил млекопитающее с помощью ножниц и дельфин 
отправился дальше осваивать морские просторы, сообщает РИА Новости.
31.08.2014, 09:49﻿

comments.text:
This amazing video captures a touching moment between a dolphin and a 
diver, when the animal asks the human for help.

The marine mammal had gotten tangled in a fishing line and had a hook 
lodged in one of its fins. The footage from the Manta Ray diving group 
shows the dolphin approaching diver Keller Laros for assistance. It calmly 
waits as Laros works to get the animal free. Watch it here: 
http://bit.ly/DolphinHelp

#Dolphins #Ocean #SeaLife #Diving #Nature﻿

comments.text:
there is another story of a woman who fell off her boat and was pulled 
under by a shark, luckily the shark didnt try to eat her and she was still 
unconscious from a head hit on the boat, three dolphins spotted her body 
and circled it, after circling her body they used their noses to make a 
sort of basket to carry her up and all three dolphins swim to the surface 
and allow her to get some vital inhales of oxygen, those dolphins saved her 
life.

comments.author: MrEarthdude

comments.text:
I lived in Japan for 15 years, and I never came across anyone who eats 
dolphins or restaurants serving dolphins. It's a rarity. There are more 
Japanese opposing the hunting of dolphins (as well as whales).

FYI, Japanese eat much less meat than the other developed countries. Meat 
consumption per capita (kg):

Japan - 44
UK - 84
France - 87
Germany - 88
Australia - 94
US - 125
New Zealand - 142
